result.execSummary:
The defendant David C Koppa Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same conditions as outlined for probation.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond on file in case 15cf89 to be applied to amounts due in that case and this case. If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with any Fleet Farm stores in Washington County.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
First 15 days to be served up front; remaining 30 days is stayed and may be imposed at probation agent's discretion. 
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Court authorizes transfer to Milwaukee County or any other jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Koppa Jr

records.addlTxt: Probation discharged.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Def in person & by Atty Jamie J LaVora.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Agreement reached on pleas; counsel free to argue at sentencing. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver. State to file Information within 48 hrs. Def pleads guilty and is convicted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
